author: Dina Katgara, Sarah Holder
description: On today’s Big Take podcast: How Trump is leaning on the Department of Justice to target his perceived political enemies — and where those cases stand.
title: Inside Trump’s Retribution Campaign

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Andrew Oxford
description: Federal prosecutors have indicted a former chief of staff to California Governor Gavin Newsom on public corruption charges, ensnaring a longtime adviser to one of the nation’s most prominent Democrats.
title: Gavin Newsom’s Ex-Chief of Staff Indicted in Corruption Case

author: Erin Fuchs
description: The Federal Trade Commission is investigating whether proxy advisory firms Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. and Glass Lewis & Co. breached US antitrust laws by guiding shareholders on how to vote on politically charged topics, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Proxy Advisers Glass Lewis, ISS Probed by US Antitrust Regulator

author: Eric Martin
description: President Donald Trump will only agree to another meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin if there is a significant opportunity to help end the war in Ukraine, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Wednesday.
title: Rubio Says Trump Needs ‘Real Chance’ of Ending War to Meet Putin

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is set to propose a plan to the US that would implement the next phase of the trade agreement the two sides reached this summer, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Prepares New Plan to Implement Trade Agreement With US

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Josh Wingrove
description: Top trade negotiators from Switzerland are headed to Washington, aiming to complete negotiations on a trade deal with the US that would lower the 39% tariff rate on Swiss goods.
title: Swiss Minister Heads to DC With Trade Deal Near Finish Line

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On this week’s Trumponomics, we discuss how the party swept off-year elections by using Donald Trump’s campaign theme against him.
title: Democrats Find a Potent Political Weapon Named ‘Affordability’

author: Rodney Jefferson, Greg Ritchie
description: Scotland was assigned its first credit ratings, a critical step on the country’s road to a debut bond sale as it seeks to attract investors during a torrid time for the UK’s finances.
title: Scotland Gets Its First Credit Ratings to Pave Way for Bond Sale

author: Gregory Korte
description: The backlog of work could take federal employees weeks to resolve.
title: US Government Looks for the ‘On’ Switch After Six-Week Shutdown

author: James Attwood, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Pilbara Minerals Ltd. is open to joining a US lithium-processing partnership that would be fed by the company’s mines in Australia or Brazil, its top executive said.
title: Pilbara Is Open to US Lithium Venture in Trump Mineral Push

author: Khalid Al Ansary
description: Preliminary results show the coalition of Iraq’s Prime Minister Mohammed Shia Al-Sudani has won the parliamentary election, with a second tenure for the incumbent premier yet to be determined.
title: Iraq PM’s Coalition Wins Parliamentary Polls, Early Results Show

author: James Woolcock
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer signed off on an official appointment he had recused himself from, in an ethics slip-up that comes as he is trying to draw a line under claims his political project is faltering.
title: Starmer Admits Ethics Mistake In Football Regulator Hiring

author: Naureen S Malik
description: Democratic Pennsylvania Governor Shapiro signed into law a bill to exit a regional market meant to cut greenhouse gas emissions, just over three years after the state joined the initiative to flight climate change.
title: Pennsylvania Moves to Exit Regional Carbon-Trading Market

author: Charles Gorrivan
description: Hemp-derived THC drinks are poised to be victims of the government spending bill ending the record-long shutdown.
title: Sales of Many Hemp-Made THC Drinks Blocked in Spending Bill

author: Erik Larson
description: Two recent high-stakes court decisions less than two hours apart laid bare the whipsawing and often divergent results for Democratic state attorneys general who’ve sought to position themselves as a courtroom foil to President Donald Trump’s agenda.
title: Trump Court Rulings Whipsaw Democratic AGs in Fractious Fight

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court scheduled arguments for Jan. 21 on President Donald Trump’s effort to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook in a pivotal clash over the central bank’s independence.
title: Supreme Court Schedules Arguments on Fed’s Lisa Cook for Jan. 21

author: Josh Wingrove, Enda Curran
description: National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said he told President Donald Trump he would accept the nomination to replace Jerome Powell as Fed chair if the job was offered, adding that he would prefer a larger interest-rate cut when policymakers meet in December.
title: Hassett Says He Would Accept Fed Chair Job, Wants Lower Rates

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US sanctioned dozens of firms and people supporting Iran’s ballistic missile and drone manufacturing industry across countries in Asia and the Middle East as part of the Trump administration’s “maximum pressure” campaign against Tehran.
title: US Sanctions Firms From China to India Over Iranian Weapons

author: Catherine Lucey, Mark Niquette
description: The October jobs and consumer price index reports are unlikely to be released due to the government shutdown, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said Wednesday.
title: October Jobs, CPI Unlikely to Be Released, White House Says

author: Jorge Valero, William Horobin, Kamil Kowalcze
description: France is urging the European Union to increase customs duties on small packages two years earlier than planned, expanding its campaign against Chinese retailers as it tangles with e-commerce giant Shein.
title: France Pushes to Accelerate Higher Duties on Chinese Parcels

author: Gonzalo Soto
description: Mexican authorities launched an investigation into casinos suspected of facilitating illegal cash transactions and money laundering with organized crime groups, in a scheme extending into the US, Europe and Central America.
title: Mexico Probe Targets Casino Ties to Organized Crime

author: Craig Stirling, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy is being lauded by ratings companies but may find high debt restrains future upgrades, according to Treasury chief Riccardo Barbieri.
title: Italy Debt Is Challenge for Future Upgrades, Treasury Chief Says

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, in keeping with past practice, said his department is prepared to alter the types of US Treasury securities it sells in response to evolving patterns of investor demand, though any changes will be gradual in order to prevent roiling markets.
title: Bessent Signals Commitment to ‘Gradual’ Changes in Debt Issuance

author: Gregory Korte, Allyson Versprille
description: The longest government shutdown in US history is coming to an end, but restarting the federal bureaucracy could take days — and in some cases a week or more — before normal operations resume.
title: Shutdown's End Will Kick Off Long Process of Rebooting US Government

author: Samy Adghirni
description: French lawmakers voted to freeze President Emmanuel Macron’s flagship pension reform, allowing the government to keep the Socialists on board in budget talks that threaten to trigger snap elections.
title: French Lawmakers Back Suspension of Macron’s Pension Reform

author: Lucy White
description: While cycling through prime ministers became a habit of the UK’s recent Conservative governments, disgruntled Labour lawmakers have much more substantial hurdles to overcome before they can force a change.
title: Starmer Rivals Face High Bar to Challenge Him as UK’s Leader

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Senegal’s ruling party said it’s dissolving the coalition that brought President Bassirou Diomaye Faye to power, heightening political uncertainty as the West African nation tries to resolve a debt crisis.
title: Senegal Dissolves Coalition Party That Helped Elect President

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz said he plans to close Army Radio, one of the country’s oldest and most popular stations, accusing it of undermining “the war effort and morale.”
title: Israel Widens Media Crackdown, Says It Will Shut One of Country’s Oldest Radio Stations

author: Alan Goldstein
description: Emails sent by Jeffrey Epstein suggest Donald Trump was aware of the late sex trafficker’s activities. The messages, released Wednesday by House Democrats, also appear to allege that the president spent hours in a house with one of Epstein’s victims.
title: Read the Epstein Emails Alleging Trump Knew of His Activities

author: Sarah Halzack
description: Bill Pulte, the Federal Housing Finance Agency director, said the administration is “actively evaluating portable mortgages,” days after President Donald Trump’s call for 50-year mortgages fell flat with industry and consumers.
title: Pulte Cites ‘Portable Mortages’ After 50-Year Idea Draws Fire

author: Jamie Tarabay, Erik Wasson
description: Disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein appeared to allege that Donald Trump spent hours in a house with one of the late sex trafficker’s victims and suggested the president was aware of his activities in emails released Wednesday by congressional Democrats.
title: Epstein Suggested in Email That Trump Knew of His Activities

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon inflated the government shutdown’s national-security impact on a secretive, ultra-long-range missile that’s key to helping the US compete militarily against China, with the Air Force later acknowledging the program was unaffected.
title: Pentagon Overstated Shutdown Impact on Secretive Missile Program

author: Swati Gupta
description: An explosion near New Delhi’s historic Red Fort on Monday that killed at least eight people and injured many more was a “terrorist incident”, India Information Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said Wednesday after a cabinet meeting.
title: India Says New Delhi Explosion Was a ‘Terrorist Incident’

author: William Horobin
description: France’s finance minister, Roland Lescure, said he’s growing in confidence that the government can get a budget though a fractured National Assembly.
title: French Finance Minister Says ‘Fairly Confident’ Budget to Pass

author: Samy Adghirni, Jenny Leonard, Alberto Nardelli
description: Emmanuel Macron is thinking about inviting Chinese President Xi Jinping to the 2026 Group of Seven summit in France and the idea has been discussed with some allies, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Macron Floats G-7 Summit Invite for China’s Xi Jinping Next Year

author: Melissa Shin
description: Canada announced new sanctions on Russia Wednesday, affecting drone makers and 100 vessels from the country’s “shadow fleet.”
title: Canada Sanctions Russian Drone Makers, ‘Shadow Fleet’ Vessels

author: Josh Wingrove
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says “substantial announcements” on coffee, bananas and other food imports are coming from the Trump administration in the next couple of days.
title: Trump Plans Move to Ease Prices on Coffee, Bananas, Bessent Says

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Jack Schlossberg, the 32-year-old grandson of former President John F. Kennedy, announced his bid for Congress, entering the race for a seat being vacated by veteran Manhattan lawmaker Jerry Nadler.
title: JFK’s Grandson Jack Schlossberg Joins Race for Manhattan Congressional District

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Friedrich Merz’s advisers trimmed their German growth forecast for next year to below 1%, underscoring the scale of challenge the chancellor faces in restoring meaningful expansion to Europe’s biggest economy.
title: Merz Advisers Revise 2026 German Growth Forecast to Below 1%

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed an order allowing Citigroup Inc. to sell its bank inside the country to Renaissance Capital.
title: Putin Allows Citigroup to Sell Its Russian Bank

author: Will Wade
description: Washington’s $80 billion investment in nuclear reactors won’t yield carbon-free power anytime soon.
title: Billions Flow to US Nuclear Sector With Payoff Still Years Away

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa’s finance minister took aim at Donald Trump as he delivered the medium-term budget update, days after the US president announced his nation would boycott the upcoming Group of 20 summit in Johannesburg.
title: South Africa Minister Slams Trump’s Genocide Claim Ahead of G-20

author: Marissa Newman
description: Sweet Security, a Tel Aviv-based startup founded by the Israeli army’s former chief information security officer, has raised $75 million in new funding.
title: Ex Israeli Army Cyber Boss Raises $75 Million for Cloud Security

author: Alex Wickham, James Woolcock
description: Keir Starmer’s allies sought to avert a leadership challenge by shining a spotlight on the ambitions of a rival for the prime minister’s job. They may have wound up strengthening the hand of those demanding a change at the top.
title: Starmer Faces Labour Backlash After Risky Bid to Quash Challenge

author: Alisa Odenheimer, Ethan Bronner
description: US President Donald Trump wrote to Israeli President Isaac Herzog and urged him to legally pardon Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who’s facing charges of bribery, fraud and breach of trust.
title: Trump Calls for Netanyahu’s Pardon in Letter to Israel President

author: Peter Laca
description: Hungary’s government bond yields have risen above Romania’s for the first time in a year, becoming the riskiest in the European Union as government plans to boost the budget deficit jolted the market.
title: Hungarian Yields Surpass Romania as EU’s Highest on Budget Risks

author: Erica Yokoyama, Toru Fujioka
description: Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said that monetary policy is vital for establishing a strong economy and stable inflation, following the first meeting of a key economic panel during her administration.
title: Takaichi Says BOJ Policy Is Very Important for a Strong Economy

author: Isobel Finkel
description: Health Secretary Wes Streeting’s denial that he’s plotting to oust Keir Starmer hasn’t prevented another government crisis.
title: Speculation Around UK Premier’s Future Won’t Go Away

author: Jarrell Dillard, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Voter frustration over affordability fueled Democratic wins in last week’s state and local elections, and on top of that, Americans are becoming uneasy about the job market too.
title: It’s Not Just Affordability, Americans Are Anxious Over Jobs Too

author: Naomi Tajitsu
description: The latest UK political drama is negative for the country’s assets, according to analysts, with uncertainties building ahead of a contentious budget.
title: UK Assets Risk Another Hit From Swirling Political Speculation

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand is extraditing an alleged casino kingpin wanted by China for his suspected role in transnational crime operations across Southeast Asia, as the governments step up crackdowns on billion-dollar scam networks deemed threats to national security.
title: Thailand Hands Over Chinese Casino Tycoon in Scam Crackdown

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: US House lawmakers return to Washington on Wednesday for a vote to end the 43-day government shutdown, which has snarled air travel, delayed food aid to millions of Americans and forced federal workers to go without pay.
title: House Poised to End Historic Shutdown Over Democrats’ Objections

author: Andrew Rosati
description: The popularity of Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva barely changed after deadly police raids last month in Rio de Janeiro stirred public debate over how to confront drug gangs.
title: Lula’s Support Steady After Bloody Police Raid in Rio de Janeiro

author: Ben Westcott
description: China’s purchases of American soybeans appear to have stalled, less than two weeks after the US touted a wide-ranging trade truce that signaled thawing relations between the world’s two biggest economies.
title: China’s Purchases of US Soybeans Stall Despite Trade Truce

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan said it is assessing the possibility of using chip export controls in its diplomatic efforts, a sign it has not completely abandoned a tool that it briefly threatened to deploy against South Africa.
title: Taiwan Says It Is Assessing the Future Use of Chip Export Curbs

author: Tooba Khan, Khalid Qayum
description: Pakistan’s parliament is considering a constitutional amendment to grant immunity to Field Marshal Asim Munir, a move that is seen to expand his influence over the South Asian nation’s defense and civilian matters.
title: Pakistan Plans Immunity for Field Marshal Munir, More Powers

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will make a visit to India in December as the two countries continue to strengthen ties despite the Kremlin’s war on Ukraine.
title: Putin to Visit New Delhi Dec. 5, Russia-India Forum Host Says

description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan opened a probe Wednesday into the suicide bombing outside an Islamabad district court that left 12 dead the day before, underscoring the challenges facing the government as it struggles with militant attacks, border tensions and a fragile ceasefire with Afghanistan.
title: Pakistan Investigates Suicide Bombing That Killed 12: AP

author: Alex Wickham, Lucy White
description: Health Secretary Wes Streeting denied plotting to oust Prime Minister Keir Starmer, but launched a series of sharp criticisms about the British leader’s political operation.
title: Streeting Denies Plot to Replace Starmer as UK Prime Minister

author: William Horobin
description: France’s central bank is likely to raise growth forecasts for this year and next as the economy continues to show resilience to political turmoil, Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.
title: Bank of France Set to Raise GDP Forecasts on Economic Resilience

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine’s Justice Minister German Galushchenko has been suspended from his post amid a corruption investigation into the country’s energy sector, Prime Minister Yuliia Svyrydenko said.
title: Ukraine Suspends Justice Minister Over Graft Probe Into Energy

author: Phila Siu
description: A new bridge in southwestern China suddenly collapsed, though officials appear to have prevented casualties by closing it a day beforehand.
title: New Bridge in Southwestern China Dramatically Collapses

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japanese Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama issued a warning regarding currency movements as the yen weakened toward the key threshold of 155 to the dollar.
title: Japan’s Finance Chief Issues Fresh FX Warning as Yen Nears 155

description: NEW YORK (AP) — John F. Kennedy's grandson Jack Schlossberg is running for the U.S. House next year, announcing Tuesday that he's seeking a key New York seat set to be vacated by longtime Democratic Rep. Jerry Nadler.
title: JFK’s Grandson Jack Schlossberg Announces Bid for New York House Seat

author: James Woolcock
description: UK business chiefs urged Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves to ease energy costs and avoid raising the tax burden on corporate Britain as she prepares this year’s budget.
title: UK Business Seeks to Swerve More Tax as Reeves Prepares Budget

author: Michael Heath
description: Australia and Indonesia have “substantively concluded” talks on a new bilateral treaty that will significantly expand their security and defense cooperation, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said.
title: Australia and Indonesia Agree to New Bilateral Security Treaty

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said the US needed skilled workers from abroad even as his administration has taken steps to make it harder for businesses to use the visa system to attract such employees.
title: Trump Defends H-1B Visas as Needed Despite Moves to Raise Costs

author: Anna Edgerton
description: The progressive challenger seeking to oust Seattle’s business-friendly mayor widened her slim lead as the final votes are tallied from the Nov. 4 election, but the race remains undecided and likely headed for a recount.
title: Seattle Progressive Expands Narrow Lead Over Mayor in Tight Race

author: Josh Wingrove, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump will host financial industry executives for dinner Wednesday at the White House, according to two officials familiar with the plans.
title: Trump Plans Dinner With Jamie Dimon, Wall Street Executives
